website_summaries.verdict: Look past the odd design of the Audeze iSine 10, and you'll find some of the best-sounding in-ear headphones we've ever heard.
pros: The iSine 10 uses planar magnetic drivers, which sound very coherent and spacious, with low distortion
Included Cipher Lightning cable has a built-in DAC that improves sound quality for iPhone and iPad users
Comfortable to wear despite the odd shape
cons: Open design leaks sound -- and allows sound in
Android users can't enjoy the benefits of the Cipher Lightning cable
The headphones don't fit everyone equally well

customer_reviews.title: Normal ears only.
customer_reviews.text: I have small ears. The attachments they give you in the box just weren’t right for me. I haven’t been able to truly use the product without sitting still so they don’t fall out. Other than that, the sound quality is phenomenal. I just wish I was able to enjoy the product. They sit on my shelf, I never get to use them because it’s not comfortable to have them just dangling on my ear barely. A definite buy if you have normal ears. But for me. It’s too late to return them. A $400 bomb for me...
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Theut

customer_reviews.title: Unusual IEMs
customer_reviews.text: For my ears they are a bit too bright. Even with the equalizer app I had trouble getting them to tone down. Using the non-cypher cable I plugged into my Topping NX4 with better results. Yes I tried all the included tips. May be just my ears. Sounds best with orchestral, jazz and folk. They are built solid.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Knight

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is okay(not really good), comfort is bad, durability is not good.
customer_reviews.text: I have also have hifiman's re-400 which cost 40 dollars. The re-400 sounds better, more comfortable , and more durable. After just few monthes of use the audeze iSine 10 hook stoped sticking well to the earphones. There are better products on the market with a fraction of the cost. Some of the headphones I own , re-400, hifiman Ananda, Audio techinca A2000z, m40x, he 4xx
customer_reviews.author: Kobi

customer_reviews.title: My iSine10's are only a month old and the cable has to be held at the perfect angle to work
customer_reviews.text: Audeze makes KILLER audio stuff. Lighting cable is not very durable though. My iSine10's are only a month old and the cable has to be held at the perfect angle to work. I should contact them about it
customer_reviews.author: DanKamYouKnow

customer_reviews.title: sound is amazing, but very, very uncomfortable in my ear.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is amazing, the best resolution I ever hear on an earphone. Great sound stage. The main reason why 3 star and a return product is because: it is heavy, big, the earpiece is also big which equal to very, very uncomfortable to wear. After 5 minutes of shoving it into my ear to see how long I can handle the pain (because it sounds so good) I had to take it off and decided this product is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tu Bui

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound!
customer_reviews.text: These sound outstanding out of my iPhone XS. Really fantastic earphones. I’m an audio geek, and own pretty nice stuff, so not the usual “Beats are incredible” kind of person. Only thing to note, is that these aren’t sealed, so not ideal for air travel. Look to something like Etymotic ER4XS in that case.
customer_reviews.author: Lee-Anna

customer_reviews.title: brilliant technology
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones, Terrific soundstage and clarity of instruments (even better than my excellent HIFi Man 400i's). I'm even tempted to say that they sound better than my Sonus Faber Venere 2.5 speakers, but maybe that is like comparing apples and oranges.Took a little tweaking to get them comfortably placed in the ear. The key is to not put them too far into the ear. But now they are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: nishi s.

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the effort..
customer_reviews.text: It took me a solid 2+ hours trying different tips and ear hooks and positioning to finally get a comfortable and consistent fit. That effort is rewarded with incredible sound from a small and portable package. I wanted a headphone that didn’t look ridiculous in public, but that would deliver great sound. I also have a lot of trouble with IEM style headphones, my ears get fatigued quickly. These don’t seem to have that effect, as they don’t go into your ears like a typical IEM. Very happy with my purchase 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by weak bass
customer_reviews.text: I found the fit to actually be decent and comfortable, but I was pretty disappointed with the bass. I'm using 3.5mm and no software, but on PC, and android they come off with weaker bass then I'm accustomed too. The sound stage does sound better then most, but I cannot get over the lack of depth I feel in the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Beejerson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reproduction but quite uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Exquisite sound for detailed listening. You will hear every imperfection in your media which may or may not appeal to different perspectives on listening. However, they are uncomfortable. Changing to foam ear tips helped immensely but the channels that go into the ear are so large that long sessions are nearly impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: So not the most comfortable to wear, but manageable. Do get the cipher cable. It makes a huge difference and really makes these come fully to life. The sound is simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: RussianRiverDog

customer_reviews.title: They have a couple frequency bumps that can be painful.
customer_reviews.text: Not super comfortable, not super light weight, not awe inspiring (for me). Just nicely made, really well packaged headphones. The sound is great once you tame the weird spike points, and fit them in your ear. they come with a nice cord and travel setup ( you put the foam and plastic box in the bag) .
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: If it fits it sits
customer_reviews.text: Not a big iem guy but after seeing tons of reviews about how big the soundstage was I had to experience them for myself. Not ideal for long listening sessions at least 2-3 hours. My ears are probably just incompatible as I’m not used to having things in my ears
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: sound
customer_reviews.text: imaging is awesome.. very clear sound、 details very impressive but not so much on the low end.. still good tho.. it's worth the money update 1-3-19. once I figured out how to put the memory ear bud in my ear the right way.. wow!!!the sound .. feels like you wearing over the ear headphones
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: a must have.
customer_reviews.text: amazing. best sounding earphones. just so different and entertaining. will treasure this for as long as i can. i never tried the isine20... a bit glad cause i don't want to spend more. lol ... but it makes me wonder if it's better thank this 10 .... the dilema. lol
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice in-ears. Great soundstage and clarity you can take ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice in-ears. Great soundstage and clarity you can take anywhere, but it leaves little in the way of isolation being semi-open back. If you’re in a car trying to listen to these and someone’s playing music on the car speakers loud enough, you won’t really be able to listen to your music that well.
customer_reviews.author: Jovan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Stax srs 002 but better
customer_reviews.text: These sound just like the stax except this has much better bass which is what was lacking with electrostatics definitely worth being your main portable headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Beyond

customer_reviews.title: These are absurdly pleasant to listen to. One of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are absurdly pleasant to listen to. One of my proudest headphone purchases, truly a value when compared to other headphones in the 4 digit range
customer_reviews.author: Theo browne

customer_reviews.title: Beat any IEM hands down for the price range.
customer_reviews.text: Sound great, a little slow, but I got sub bass with these. You wont lose if you go with these.
customer_reviews.author: Inkey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: For the cost the quality of the plastic and design where sub par, needed super glue to hold them together and even then the wire over the ears is a joke
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones
customer_reviews.text: These are all around great earphones. They have surprisingly little noise leak despite being open back.
customer_reviews.author: Salem

customer_reviews.title: I love the sound out of these IEM's
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound out of these IEM's. The cables and plastic accessories can be of better quality, but the headphones are solid. Sound is crisp and clear on the highs, the mids are detailed and don't make any sacrifices because of its balanced lows. I like a bit more bass than the neutral sound these headphones offer, so I downloaded a "bass boost" app on my phone, an viola. The best sounding headphones across all types, imo.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M.

customer_reviews.title: Returned them as I wasn't knocked out with their sound ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned them as I wasn't knocked out with their sound. I don't use my iOS devices to listen to my music and apparently the iOS dac/cable that you can use with them makes quite an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: F. Pantalone

customer_reviews.title: Addictive and Sweet
customer_reviews.text: The iSINE10 handles jazz, pop, hip-hop, and classical all very well. Soundstage is wide and deep. Bass and treble are non-fatiguing and the midrange is sweet and detailed. Fitting on my ears using the clear hooks sometimes took a few tries but it stayed put once inserted. Obtaining a tight seal is a matter of moving the silicon tips back and forth. The iSine10 has very minimal isolation so it is easy to hear outside sounds. The flat and lightweight cable can be secured with a clip to keep it from swinging around too much. The sound quality of the iSine10 is addictive and reveals satisfyingly more than any other headphone that I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetMan

customer_reviews.title: Being my ears are shaped funny i couldnt get them not to hurt my ears ...
customer_reviews.text: They had awsome sound. Being my ears are shaped funny i couldnt get them not to hurt my ears the sound on them was good the bass was awsome not to over powdering the mids were point on ! I felt bad takeing the ears back DUE to how they hurt my ears. Good earbuds for your money tho !
customer_reviews.author: mike dorazio

customer_reviews.title: Very poor fit and no comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very poor fit and no comfort... While Planar headphone usually sound good these one are just bizarre especially at the price... Maybe for under a $100 dollars I would reconsider... But for $400 I really don't want to look like Shrek... To make them fit you have to use hooks... And that makes your years look very Shrek'ish... And the fit is just uncomfortable... I think Audeze is onto something here, but for now it is not a great product...
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: The ear phones were delivered with only 1 small ear ...
customer_reviews.text: The ear phones were delivered with only 1 small ear tip. There were supposed to be6 ear tips in all. I got 5. I want a set of small ear tips sent to me ASAP or sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pores

customer_reviews.title: The left side sounded crunchy like I had water in my ear
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a defective pair. The left side sounded crunchy like I had water in my ear. I tried the left side in my right ear and it sounded the same, so it wasn't me or my ear. Also, I tried all three tips and could not get the seal right; there was no bass. No sub bass. Nothing. So, I returned them. Maybe if I got a pair that did not have the crunchy sound and had a better selection of tips, it may have been worth keeping. I tried these with a Fiio X5 gen 3 and a Fiio A5, and my LG G6 phone.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The best value for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: I did not buy from Amazon but got it from Audeze bstock including bluetooth costed me $250. Also I'm not audio expert or an audiophile just normal/regular music listener. I bought Shure SE535 from Amazon but so low in bass than Bose sound sport wireless. Then read about this and tried simply the best period. Fitting in my ears felt much easier than Bose or Shure and audio experience is amazing! try it and hear yourself you will feel the difference. Update: After you get your IEM's and register on Audeze and later buy bluetooth CIPHER(discount code) cable on Audeze you get 50% off. So the total cost comes to $200. It's just STEAL for the value they give.
customer_reviews.author: Tej Vem

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but rude company with little to no support.
customer_reviews.text: They died after only a few months and customer support really did not offer any support even though they were like new when they died and had suffered no physical damage. Additionally, I was hoping to use these with both my pc and my oculus rift, however in order to get the cable the extremely rude representative informed me I would have to purchase a whole separate pair, and that there was no way they could proved just the cables to me. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Briscoe

customer_reviews.title: I MEANN..... not perfect but they can sound amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not getting rid them, BUT when I use them I have to use an equalizer, which means on Android I spent 5 more dollars on these headphones. After EQ taming of the treble and for me the 1khz Scream they are extremely enjoyable. You don't shove these into your ears btw you rest the eartip a little in your ear hole, that tip from Audeze when I called them is what changed my mind, they became way more comfortable after that. I heated the ear hangers and Bent them to prevent the tip diving into my ear canal which makes these extremely comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR ANDROID USE
customer_reviews.text: These are designed to be use with a complex EQ, as built into their apple-only 'Cipher' dsp cable. You can try to recreate the effect through android's EQ options, but honestly it will never sound quite right, as it's too complex an EQ to replicate. AUDEZE THEMSELVES do not recommend use without that EQ. They sound like wonky garbage without it. If your willing to go through the immense hassle, or if your using them for apple, or if you using them on a PC and willing to download the 'reveal' plugin and use a program to run it (equalizer.apo, both free) then it's an excellent sound in a rather cheap-o package.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought the b-stock for 150 bucks I figured Audeze sound for $150 how can I go wrong.. I'll give it that the mids and the sense of space is there but that is about it. There is little to no bass at all it almost give a plastic sound with the kicks. The only way to get more bass out the earphones is to use the App. So without the app no bass.. But you can turn around and plug in the earbuds that you get for free from Apple when you buy an iPhone and get way more bass out of it, stock. Don't let anyone fool you they are pretty uncomfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: takeshi lewis

customer_reviews.title: I Love the sound (even the base and high row off ...
customer_reviews.text: I Love the sound (even the base and high row off a bit)... The music is very cohesive, unlike a lot of other headsets. You know, there's sound and there is music. Sound doesn't always equal music. These plays music! I use the hooks I have no problem with them. But I agree that they don't have too much information to put them on. I guess people need to try them.
customer_reviews.author: Waikwong Yeung

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE sound, no matter what artist I'm listening to!
customer_reviews.text: These Audeze headphones, while small in size, deliver INCREDIBLE sound. Whether I'm listening to K.Flay, Cold War Kids, The Bleachers, Milky Chance, Lorde, or anything else in my many, many, playlists - the sound quality is unmatched. I take them with me everywhere I go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Audeze iSINE10 in-Ear | Semi-Open Headphone
feature_bullets: MAXIMUM CLARITY: Hear every beat with maximum clarity. These headphones are built using our proprietary technology, delivering vivid sound, deep bass and balanced treble.
GREAT AUDIO EVERYWHERE: The lightweight, modern industrial design of the iSINE10 is exceptionally durable, delivering great sound wherever you go.
SUPERIOR RESOLUTION: Our innovative planar magnetic drivers use NASA material to provide lower distortion, better bass response, and a wider soundstage than any other in-ear headphone.

CUSTOMIZABLE AUDIO: Your perfect mix is always just a few taps away. Use the Audeze iOS app to boost bass or elevate mids in real time featuring a 10-band equalizer and two savable presets that let you make any genre of music sound exactly the way you like it. AND the settings travel with the cable.

LIGHTNING CABLE W/ MIC FOR HANDS-FREE CALLING: Get uncompromised audio for music and voice calls. Our MFI cetified cable comes with a in-line Amplifier, 24-bit digital to analog converter that brings the music to life. The mic is Siri-compatible keeping communication simple.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars100 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
